body.p:
E. Town Feby 22 1861
G W. Johnson Esqre
My dear Sir
I receive your letter this moment. Would have written you sooner had the promise of Eight Thousand dollars. Very shortly when pd, shall be pd on your debt.

I fear I shall not get any think from the South for some time, should things take a change I will of the debt than rest ashured my dear sir that every effort on my part shall be to pay you the balance at as early day as possible.
I will a join you when I pay the 8000$ on the note.

Truly Your Friend
S. B. Thomas
